experiences.name: Meta University Internship
experiences.description: During summer 2022 I was an Meta University Intern for 10 weeks, I was working in the Web track. I learned NodeJS, React, Express and Parse.
experiences.technologies: HTML, CSS, Javascript, React, NodeJS, ExpressJS, Back4App, Parse & Axios.

projects.name: Life & Health
projects.description: Life & Helath is an app where you will be able to record personal health information, illnesses, appointments, important contacts, selected first aid information and can match your illnesses with a specialist within your location radius.
projects.technologies: HTML, CSS, Javascript, React, NodeJS, ExpressJS, Back4App, Parse & Axios.

projects.name: Roll n' Score
projects.description: A multiplayer video game that consists of 10 players divided in 2 teams moving on a gravityfree field trying to score as many goals as possible in 3 minutes.

projects.name: Fast Colors
projects.description: Game where you will put your reflexes to the test avoiding the colored bars, You will find 2 basic modes. 'Normal' and 'Hardcore', where you will simply dodge the colored bars, you will also find a section with more modes, each one will have a different challenge or obstacle.
projects.highlights: My first mobile game at 16 years old

projects.name: Home Security System
projects.description: During a wek in my college, my teammates and I developed a Web App able to track your home security system from your phone.
projects.technologies: React Native, Firebase Realtime Database, NodeMCU & C++.

projects.name: Project Pixel Light (working title)
projects.description: It's a platforming-fighting 3D game that sports a graphic design known as “HD-2D”, consisting of 2D characters or sprites interacting in a 3D world.
projects.highlights: 3D Fighting system & Like-Super Mario Bros Games Physics
